Using this formula, we'll get the following table: x | 0 1 2 3 -----------|------------------------------- P(X=x) | .5 .4 .3 .2 The values that x can get (0,1,2,3) are the same as the ones in our distribution above. And even more importantly, note that this is not a legitimate probability distribution since the sum of all probabilities is not 1, as it should be.

Good Job! Using this formula, we'll get P(X=1)=(5-1)/10=.4 P(X=2)=(5-2)/10=.3 etc. to get the following probability distribution: x | 1 2 3 4 -----------|------------------------------- P(X=x) | .4 .3 .2 .1 which is exactly the one represented by the histogram above.
